package_deals.name: Patron Starter Pack
package_deals.description: Contains Patron Chests, Patron Currency, and Supply Chests.

package_deals.name: Patron Skin Pack
package_deals.description: Contains a unique Patron-exclusive Skin and bonus Patron Currency.

event_details.name: Bardic Inspiration Weekend
event_details.description: [Not Shown In Game For Mini Events]

details.shop_desc: Each Gold One-HewMaan-Band Chest contains five cards, of which two are guaranteed to be equipment for Hew Maan, Calliope, Deekin, Paultin, or Orisha (at least one of which will be rare or better; only for unlocked Champions; does not unlock the Champion if you don't already own it)
details.promo_buff_desc: Have you listened to the new in-game soundtrack yet?
details.promo_chest_desc: Check out these limited-time Gold One-HewMaan-Band Chests that contain equipment for just the five Champions to the left! (Note: only for unlocked Champions - if you do not have Hew Maan, Deekin, Paultin, or Orisha unlocked, their gear will not appear in the chests)

adventure_defines.name: Cold & Wet
adventure_defines.description: Head to Candlekeep, but watch your step and take an umbrella!
adventure_defines.restrictions_text:
Two members of the Flaming Fist escort the Champions to Candlekeep, changing slots every 25 areas.
In areas where it is raining, Champions' damage is reduced by 99% and enemies drop 99% less gold.

adventure_defines.name: A Hero's Entourage
adventure_defines.description: Patrol the streets of Baldur's Gate with its hometown hero and survive its seedy underbelly.
adventure_defines.requirements_text:
Must have completed "The Dead Three"
Must have completed 5 Descent into Avernus adventures or variants
adventure_defines.restrictions_text:
Minsc starts out in the formation and can not be removed or swapped out.
Champions can only be placed adjacent to Minsc. 
When Minsc is moved, any Champions that are not adjacent to him after the move will be removed from the formation.

adventure_defines.name: The Dead Three
adventure_defines.description: Patrol the streets of Baldur's Gate and survive its seedy underbelly.
adventure_defines.requirements_text: Must have completed "A Tale of Two Cities"

campaign_defines.name: Baldur's Gate: Descent into Avernus
campaign_defines.description: Baldur's Gate has become gripped by the forces of Hell and needs a merry band of Champions to save the day.

quest_defines.description: The day is as dark as your collective mood as you leave Baldur's Gate -- making an attack by vultures almost seem a useful distraction.
More vultures appear, following the refugees from Elturel. Convince these carrion birds to seek prey elsewhere!
The chaos of refugees on the roads seems to have startled the creatures of the forest. Before you can go mushroom picking, you'll need to clear these rabbits out!
Another flock of rabbits is running amok -- and whatever's spooked them is close at hand.
A pack of crocodile hatchlings on the prowl is behind these disturbances! And their battle-scarred mother seems intent on showing her brood the finer points of hunting!
This torrential rain promises to make the journey to Candlekeep a gloomy slog. Good thing you're not also being attacked by skunks!
As fast as you clear these skunks out, more of them lurch out from the underbrush!
You're going to need to find dry tinder if you have any hope of staying warm at your next stop -- but these wolves aren't making the search easy for you.
The wolves aren't just on the hunt. Something has this pack riled up!
Finish off this alpha werewolf quickly, and the rest of the wolves should scatter!
Pushing on through the heart of these woods will reduce your travel time. But malicious satyrs are going to do their best to slow you down anyway!
A bit of rest and the uplifting tone of heroic tales will do you good -- assuming these imps leave you alone!
That satyr pack is back! Perhaps disarming these disruptive fey will cool them off!
Another night's rest is disrupted by another pack of imps. Clear these tiny fiends out!
The imps pursue you as you continue on your way -- and the greater imp that leads them seems intent on ending your journey early!
Finally, some much-needed sun! But a swarm of giant flies has taken to the clear skies in a frenzy!
The rain falls like a hammer blow once more -- and drives a pack of boars from hiding!
These boars seem intent on a fight to the finish! Collecting tusks from a few of them might calm the rest down.
Wereboars join the fight -- and whip the last of the boar pack into a fighting frenzy!
The wereboars fall back to make a last stand -- and have a dire wolf fighting alongside them!
The rain breaks again! And these evil scarecrows are looking to dry out with a little combat!
The scarecrows mean to mob this farmstead! Push them back!
This fight will destroy Kaddrus's carrot crop unless you lend a hand!
Betrayal! The cambion Kaddrus brings a pack of spined devils to join the fray!
Another squad of spined devils defends their cambion master! Take these fiends down!
Fewer devils! More rain! The journey to Candlekeep continues!
Just as these wild dogs seemed about to break, an attack by sneak thieves emboldens them!
The mud of the farm fields is letting the thieves home in on your tracks too easily. Smashing some of these pumpkins can help cover your trail!
These wizardly bandits have done a deal with the cambion. Time to make them a serious counteroffer!
The thieves have scattered, but the bandit wizards have a clay golem! Hit this construct hard!
The approach to Candlekeep is at hand! And these wolves seem intent on giving you a warm welcome!
The Way of the Lion is swarming with thieves looking to rob those heading for Candlekeep. Send these villains packing!
The rainstorm that's been following you has made a mess of the road. Collect some of the rain-soaked tinder. Hopefully it'll dry before your next night at camp.
These troublesome thieves finally break -- which gives the wolves you scattered earlier a chance to regroup!
These bandit wizards seem anxious for a rematch. Show them how much you've been looking forward to it as well!
As long as you're waiting in this basement library, you might as well lend the monks of Candlekeep a hand with some pest control!
Time to meet Sylvira at last! And it looks like these rodents are intent on coming along!
Little One will be forever collecting the books Sylvira needs by himself. Time to lend a hand!
These kenku rogues have shown their worth by breaking into Candlekeep undetected. Too bad their mission is going to end in failure!
The kenku regroup for another assault! Take their leader out and the rest will scatter!
On your way to Sylvira's laboratory, you find the dungeon corridors of Candlekeep in dire need of some de-infestation! Take these vermin out!
You don't want to risk Sylvira becoming distracted by her animated servants. Get these constructs under control!
These awakened objects are making a mess of the place! Clear up these scattered spell components, quickly!
The last of Sylvira's construct servants mob you! Time to put this uprising down for good!
A surprise assault! Show this cambion and its diabolical servants that they were lucky to escape from the Champions once!
Getting to Traxigor's island was easy enough. Getting through the dense forest that surrounds the tower is another matter!
Giant spiders are everywhere! Drive these monstrous vermin back!
Web-spinning spiders are trying to hem you in! Tear these webs down before you're trapped!
As fast as you drive them back, the spiders only seem to fly into a greater frenzy! What's driven these arachnids into a rage?
This succubus has been a messenger of Zariel all along. Time for the Champions to send a message in return!
Taking on an assignment for the Flaming Fists isn't much to your liking -- so best to get this job over with quickly!
Even as marauding seagulls flee, a pack of giant rats enters the fray!
These belligerent sailors are more annoying than dangerous. Seize their weapons to get their numbers down.
The sailors are on the run -- but another pack of rats keeps you from clearing them out for good!
Taking out this pirate captain should convince his lackeys that this fight isn't theirs to win. Hit him hard!
The farther you push into the city, the more chaotic things get. Clear these rats out while you can!
Even as the rats begin to fall back, a flock of seagulls hems you in!
These gulls are relentless. Clip their wings to slow them down!
A pack of wild dogs slips out from the shadows -- and the rats that pursue you make a sudden surge in response!
A monstrous mastiff leads this pack -- and isn't going to back down without a fight!
The dogs are on the run, but they're not the only predators at large in the city. Time to cut this gang of thieves down to size!
The thieves put up a strong fight -- and the wild dogs use the respite to make another assault!
These urban bandits focus too much on their fine outfits. Collect some of their gloves to teach them a lesson.
You can't get to the Masked Man as long as these dogs press you. Drive this pack back!
The Masked Man seems intent on letting this gang of thieves take point in your rematch! Hit them hard!
No matter where you go in Baldur's Gate, the pandemonium never stops! Another wave of giant rats and seagulls pushes in!
The presence of these rats reveals its sinister overtones. Wererats! Look sharp!
As another wave of wererats pursues you, the scattered pieces of stone become a battlefield hazard! Clear this rubble, and quickly!
The wererats are on the run -- but a pack of giant rats presses in to keep you from pursuing!
The leader of this wererat mob summons their followers for a last stand!
The last of the wererats scatter -- but not fast enough to get away from your wrath!
The last stage of the wererat fight has enraged a flock of seagulls! Watch out!
This bathhouse features some unusual passersby. Save this stranger and clear these imps out!
Fists of Bane come to the aid of the bathhouse's fiendish protectors! Take down these brutish guards!
Even with more guards at hand, the lesser imps are on the run -- but their more powerful master is a foe to be reckoned with!
The dungeons beneath the bathhouse are a dark labyrinth --  and warriors in the service of Myrkul are on the move!
Abyssal chickens! Those amusing yet deadly fiends swarm forth from the darkness in service to the evil masters of this place!
These necromites place too much faith in their dread master. Capture these symbols of Myrkul to make their followers think twice about challenging you!
A pack of foul dretches fights at the necromites' command!
This skull lasher channels Myrkul's unholy power in a final assault! Hit these cultists hard!
The twisting tunnels beneath the bathhouse yield up unexpected denizens!
The kobolds push in from both sides!
Stolen trade goods amassed by the cults have been piled up as a makeshift barricade! Push through!
Another pack of abyssal chickens surges forth from the shadows! Stand fast!
The kobold pack regroups for a final assault -- and is letting a minotaur skeleton take point!
Fists of Bane and necromites of Myrkul join forces to block your progress! Fight on!
A deadly dretch pack is summoned forth by Bane's devout followers!
Claiming the symbols worn by these worshipers of the Lord of Darkness might break their resolve!
The forces of Bhaal and Bane press hard! Don't let them hem you in!
The iron consul leads Bane's forces in a final assault!
Bhaal's forces send another round of abyssal chickens to soften you up!
Still more abyssal chickens swarm you from the darkness! Stand fast!
These horrid dretches return to make an even more potent threat! Claim their foul ichor to keep these fiends down!
As fast as you drop the dretches, more of their dark kind hurl themselves against you from the shadows!
As you push forward, a shadow imp enters the fray -- and the fiends it commands redouble their attacks!
A last force of Bane's warriors presses you hard! Stand fast!
You have the fists of Bane on the run -- but a pack of imps threatens to overwhelm you!
These imps are summoned by the servants of Bhaal! Break that dark god's symbol to break their resolve!
Myrkul's forces step up where Bhaal's servants have fallen! Fight on!
The forces of the Dead Three unite for a final stand! Time to end this!

sequence.text: Ye should stop complainin', drow.
I'm just saying. It's five days on the road to Candlekeep. Look at the size of this party. You're telling me none of these arcanists can cast teleport?
Gonna need tha length o' this walk ta clear me head, frankly. We're leavin' unfinished business and refugees in Baldur's Gate. We got nothin' ta drive us on but faint hope that Elturel can be saved.
Well, thanks for this talk, Bruenor. You've improved my outlook mightily.
These vultures are relentless. We must slow them down or they slow us to standstill.
There -- that forest ahead. There's a path that shadows the road that should give us some cover.
sequence.name: Reya

sequence.text: And I see another good reason to detour. Look there in the undergrowth -- it's the same wild mushrooms that Terminatur introduced us to.
Oi! Them fungi was fine eatin' when we met that gnome. Nothin' better fer keepin' tha spirits up on a long march than a good stew. Let's do some harvestin'!

Barely a day on this road and I've already lost track of the number of creatures that have tried to kill me. Seriously, now. Asharra? Strix? Dhadius? Delina? None of you know teleport? Summon coach cab? Anything?
You fret now, boss. But Deekin always says, 'Bad as things are, they get worse soon.'
Deekin, I'm quite certain we've had the conversation where we discussed how you are decidedly not in charge of pep talks.
Doom...
The weather turns. Clouds darken. That scent on the air. Rain is coming.
Minsc, it started raining a half-hour ago. We've just been in thick enough forest that you haven't noticed.
Ah. Minsc was wondering why trees were wet but head stays dry.
Squee!
sequence.name: Boo

sequence.text: This rain ain't lettin' up -- and tha weather ain't improvin' these wolves' mood!
That makes two of us. Well, one of me and several dozen of them. Wait... there! I can see a werewolf leading this pack.
That explains them fightin' as hard as they has been -- and gives us somethin' ta strike at. Come on!
Right, we done a solid slog and no mistake. 'Tis almost too dark ta keep on. Best we look fer a place ta camp, and soon.

We could all do with a break. And we need to think about our next move. Share what information we can. Reya, I'm hoping you can tell us more about the Hellriders, and about Zariel. The old stories often hold hidden truths.
I'm happy to share what I know, Celeste. But it's a dark tale -- and is growing even darker, I fear.
sequence.name: Reya

sequence.text: I know some of the old histories of Elturel, from a hundred years ago. Elturgard, the lands around the city, were under constant assault by fiends. Farms were ruined, livestock destroyed. But the fate of those captured and dragged off by devils was far worse.

The terror was the worst of it, or so the old writings say. No matter how many fiends the city cavalry destroyed, no matter how far they ranged, they could not stem the tide. In the end, the High Rider who was the ruler of Elturel led prayers to the gods for aid. And the next day, Zariel the archangel came.
sequence.name: Reya

sequence.text: Her name means 'Companion of Light,' I believe. It was a turning point. Or should have been.
I ain't meanin' ta interrupt ye, Reya, Celeste. But there's Minsc hustlin' back from patrol on tha run -- and he ain't alone!

It was Zariel who knew the gate through which the fiends were entering Elturgard, on the Fields of the Dead west of Elturel. It was she who declared that she would lead the cavalry into Avernus, where the devils were massing.
sequence.name: Reya

sequence.text: A daunting mission. And an unprecedented chance to strike at the heart of evil.

Yes. Or at least it should have been. Thousands of riders went forth, following Zariel through the gate. But the host of Avernus weathered the assault. Zariel was defeated, and the survivors returned to Elturel.
sequence.name: Reya

sequence.text: But even with the archangel lost, the attack accomplished something.
In its way, yes. The survivors named themselves the Hellriders, in memory of the sacrifice made by so many. And Elturel seemed safe, for a time at least. But no more.
sequence.name: Reya

sequence.text: Doom!
Oi! Relax there, ye scaredy-kobold. 'Tis just a story.
No, doom! There! Doom!
Gah! That brightness in the sky! What is it?
Settle down, elf. It ain't been rainin' that long that ye forgot about tha sun.
Sorry. Old drow habits die hard. Finally, some warmth! My boots are so soaked, it feels as though we've been walking underwater.
Ah, but as Deekin always says...
No. Deekin says nothing. Nothing!
Listen to that smell. The lightning is on the storm. The air, it crackles. Crackle crackle.
Stop. Use the power of positive thinking.
Doom...
Enough from you! Gah! Not again...
Look there. Clouds part and depart. The birds call out once more.
All lies. I don't believe a word of it.
Oi, elf. Tha sun's shinin' again is all he's sayin'.
I won't truck with false hope. This trip has broken me, Bruenor...
These evil constructs aren't going to break until the last of them is destroyed!
Watch out! There's someone trying to push past them.
sequence.name: Reya

sequence.text: Champions! I thought it was you. I'd recognize you heroes anywhere.
sequence.name: Kaddrus

sequence.text: Can't say we ain't pleased ta have our reputation proceed us, friend. But this fight's not a place ye wanna be.
On the contrary, Bruenor. This is my farm the scarecrows have infested, and I'll defend it at your side. Fight on!
sequence.name: Kaddrus

sequence.text: The scarecrows are breaking finally. One last assault should finish them.
sequence.name: Reya

sequence.text: And not a moment too soon. I didn't think I could hold out on my own much longer.
sequence.name: Kaddrus

sequence.text: Gotta say, Kaddrus, this is a lot o' farmstead fer only one bloke ta tend. Ye need ta get yerself some hired hands.
Oh, I have friends nearby, never fear. And a good thing too, looking at the number of you. For I'm not the young man I used to be...
sequence.name: Kaddrus

sequence.text: What in... Treachery! Spined devils surround us! I see your true form now, Cambion.
Yes, well, I did say I had friends nearby, didn't I? Now let me introduce you all properly!
sequence.name: Kaddrus

sequence.text: Focus on the dwarf! Get that shield off his back -- or off his corpse!
sequence.name: Kaddrus

sequence.text: That's yer game is it, cambion? Am I right in thinkin' ye and whatever creature's trapped in this relic is old friends?
I don't divulge my plans to my enemies, dwarf. Not that you'll be around for long to repeat them...
sequence.name: Kaddrus

sequence.text: How ye talkin' now, ye fair fiend? Yer devil friends is dispatched back ta tha Nine Hells that spawned 'em. Ye gonna step up now to take yer turn?
Fie on you and all your companions, dwarf. And watch your backs! I will have the shield of the hidden lord! And none of you will reach Candlekeep alive if I have anything to say about it!
sequence.name: Kaddrus

sequence.text: Oi. Ye doin' all right?
Why wouldn't I be?
Well, just on account o' how it's startin' in rainin' again.
Weather is just a state of mind, Bruenor. I'm a professional adventurer. There's nothing nature can throw at me that can't be countered by a positive state of mind.
Can't help but notice ye also got Deekin standin' behind ye and heftin' up a mighty big umbrella.
Doom...
Can't hear either of you over my positive state of mind.
These accursed thieves have wizardly backup! There's more to this attack than banditry.
sequence.name: Reya

sequence.text: I've got a feeling I know who's behind it. You there! You lead this motley band? Bring out the cambion and let him fight his own battles!
Tough talk, paladin. But the coin Kaddrus has offered is enough for us to fight any battle he wants -- and what we'll gain from selling that armor of yours will only add to our profit!
sequence.name: Bandit Wizard

sequence.text: Finally! An inn to take some shelter from this wretched weather. The Way of the Lion is just ahead -- the road to Candlekeep. It won't be long now.
Do you really think one of the scholars there will be able to help us?
sequence.name: Reya

sequence.text: I do -- and one scholar in particular. A mage named Sylvira Savikas. A specialist in infernal magic.
It'll be good ta take a bit o' time ta dry off and get some grub before we get down ta talkin'. I'm so hungry, me stomach's howlin'.
Minsc thinks you mean 'growling.' Or Minsc thinks that is not your hunger you hear...
Boss, look! Sun is out!
So it is. I hadn't really noticed it had gone. Positive thinking, Deekin.
Deekin think very positive, boss. So Deekin gets to dry off now?
Maybe in a bit.
There, on the road ahead. It's one of the priests of Candlekeep. Everyone, search your packs for books.
Ye sure Celeste? Seems a strange time fer a readin' break.
It's not for reading, Bruenor. Admission to Candlekeep costs a book that the monks don't already have in their collection. I'm sure one of us will have something.
Welcome travelers. I will escort you the rest of the way. I trust your journey was pleasant?
sequence.name: Priest of Deneir

sequence.text: Absolutely bracing.
Boss...
Quiet back there. And watch out! Those bandit wizards are back!
Deekin, I've told you before, hold that umbrella still. If my hat gets rumpled, it's coming out of your share of the treasure.
But boss, Deekin is fetching book from pack for Celeste and priest fellow! Special book that no one else has, because Deekin makes it. The Book... of Doom!
That sounds... interesting, Deekin. What is it?
Deekin writes down all the doom seen since joining the Champions. Very long book, it is.
And it will serve us nicely. Well done, Deekin.
Well done indeed, my kobold friend. Come, all of you. Candlekeep awaits.
sequence.name: Priest of Deneir

sequence.text: So this is Candlekeep. A little more grim than I expected, to be honest.
This is just the basement, Jarlaxle. The priests are expecting some kind of trouble. They thought it best if we waited here until they have it sorted. Sylvira has been notified that we're here.
Sorry, I must have missed some of that. This umbrella keeps hitting my ears.
Boss?
Yes, all right, you can put it down. But stay close just in case.
No, boss! Warning! Rats!
Them rats ain't lettin' up. And look there! Ogre! Watch yerselves!
Ogre?! Where?! Oh, I see -- you mean me. I'm so sorry, I forget sometimes. Allow me to introduce myself. They call me Little One.
sequence.name: Little One

sequence.text: Err, yeah. And sorry. Ain't used ta most ogres bein' quite as high-talkin' as yerself.

No apologies necessary. The magic of the headband I wear makes me... somewhat special. But I've prattled on too long. I've been sent to collect some books for Sylvira Savikas, and to bring you to her. But it looks like we have rats to deal with first!
sequence.name: Little One

sequence.text: These rats is almost on tha run finally. One more attack should finish 'em.
Yes. Let's hope that one attack leaves you all just a bit weaker, Champions.
sequence.name: Kenku Leader

sequence.text: Here, now. All of you. Visitors aren't permitted down here except by invitation.
sequence.name: Little One

sequence.text: Oh, we have our invitation -- courtesy of Kaddrus. Champions! Turn over the shield of the hidden lord, or this library is the last place you'll see!
sequence.name: Kenku Leader

sequence.text: I should have realized. The trouble the monks are having must be Kaddrus still trying to seize the shield. That cambion is annoyingly persistent.

Oh, friends. Even one who seeks this relic can only be less dangerous than the relic itself. I have read of the shield of the hidden lord in the old books. There is a dark spirit held within it. I hear its voice even now.
sequence.name: Little One

sequence.text: Welcome to the club.
We have a more immediate problem. If Kaddrus guesses that we're trying to reach Sylvira, he might try to thwart us -- and she might be in danger. Little One, lead us to her, quickly!
Ah, Champions. So the rumors from the gates were true. We are well met.
sequence.name: Sylvira

sequence.text: Meeting you is all the honor, Sylvira. Your reputation runs far and wide. We have brought danger to Candlekeep despite our best intentions, but our need is great. We think this infernal puzzle box might hold some clue to the fate of Elturel.
Elturel! A fiendish puzzle, you've brought me. But what's that noise? Oh, confound it! I animated some construct servants this morning, and their programming hasn't taken.
sequence.name: Sylvira

sequence.text: Ye don't mind me suggestin' it, Sylvira, we can tidy up them servants fer ye while ye puzzle out this puzzle box. We got no time ta lose.
Nicely done, Champions. I appreciate the assistance. And I think I can return the favor with information. I've opened the puzzle cube -- but the secrets it holds are not for the faint of heart.
sequence.name: Sylvira

sequence.text: Doom...
Deekin, watch the door, will you? Let the grown-ups talk.
Your instincts were correct, Celeste. This cube holds the secret to the fate of Elturel. Thavius Kreeg's treachery has doomed the city and all its people.
sequence.name: Sylvira

sequence.text: That cannot be. The power of the Companion and the Creed Resolute was a strength that no one should have been able to break.
sequence.name: Reya

sequence.text: But the Creed Resolute was Kreeg's weapon. Long have I mistrusted that overseer. The puzzle box holds Kreeg's contract with Zariel, granting dominion over Elturel and each soul bound by the Creed Resolute.
sequence.name: Sylvira

sequence.text: But everyone in Elturel has signed the creed. This means... gods, no...
sequence.name: Reya

sequence.text: Bosses! Everyone! Trouble!
Well met again, Champions. You are a decidedly tenacious bunch.
sequence.name: Kaddrus

sequence.text: A cambion! Most unusual. And no friend of yours, I assume?
sequence.name: Sylvira

sequence.text: An enemy, sworn and true. You grow tired of sending your minions against monks and scholars, Kaddrus? Let us show you what a real fight looks like.
My minions' one purpose was to wear you down and let me learn your intent in coming here, paladin. And what I've learned will serve me well -- once the shield of the hidden lord is mine!
sequence.name: Kaddrus

sequence.text: I'm sorry for bringing this violence to your laboratory, Sylvira. But we should take our leave now. We need to think on what your revelations mean for Elturel. This is dire news.

But no, Celeste, we were interrupted. Thavius Kreeg's contract, you see. It has given Zariel dominion over Elturel. But the city and its people must be fully claimed. A long process, given the chaos that the Blood War unleashes across Avernus.
sequence.name: Sylvira

sequence.text: You mean... Elturel has gone... but it might not yet have fallen.
Exactly. If you go to Avernus, you might yet save the city. There might still be time.
sequence.name: Sylvira

sequence.text: I'm sorry, go where now?

Go quickly, Champions. Seek supplies in the library, then make for the griffon platform. From there, you'll be flown to the island tower of a mage named Traxigor. He can cast plane shift to take you to Avernus.
sequence.name: Sylvira

sequence.text: All right, I think it's time to put this to a vote...
Less yakkin' and more packin', elf. Everybody, grab up any magic Candlekeep can spare. We got a city ta save!
I just want it to be known that I am here under duress. Someone write that down. Deekin!
Yes, boss. Deekin starting new Book of Doom.
Ah, there you are. Sylvira messaged me of your arrival. I trust the griffon flight was to your liking?
sequence.name: Traxigor

sequence.text: Whee! Yes!
No.
Ignore those two. Traxigor, can you do this for us? Take us to Avernus?
I can't say I'm happy to do so, but if that's your wish and Candlekeep's command, it shall be done. But I'll need a few minutes to prepare.
sequence.name: Traxigor

sequence.text: Oi! What's that trumpetin' sound?
That's Lulu, my companion. And she's sounding a warning. Watch yourselves!
sequence.name: Traxigor

sequence.text: Traxigor! Are you all right?
sequence.name: Lulu

sequence.text: Just fine, Lulu, thanks to these fine new friends.
sequence.name: Traxigor

sequence.text: My word! What a unique creature.
Yes, Lulu is a hollyphant. And potentially a resource to you on your quest, for she knows much of the Nine Hells. But quickly, we must move. Those spiders are back!
sequence.name: Traxigor

sequence.text: Them spiders is mountin' another offensive. Get ready!
Bruenor, stand fast! It's a distraction. I sense a great evil behind us... there!
Ah, Champions. We keep doing this same dance, you and I. Shall we finish it here, once and for all?
sequence.name: Succubus

sequence.text: We'll finish it, yes. And when what passes for your soul is sent shrieking back to your master, tell Zariel we're coming for her.
Ha! You can tell her yourself, I think. If I'd known before how intent you were on traveling to Zariel's domain, I would have offered to escort you there myself!
sequence.name: Succubus

sequence.text: One fiend down. How many more ta go?

If what we're to face on Avernus is anything like I expect, you won't want to keep a count. Champions. You all know what we're about to do. Where we're going. We'll need to stick together. Stand fast and hold to the light.
Still having second thoughts, Jarlaxle?
It'll be fine. Positive thinking.
That's the spirit, new friend. Always think on the good things, or so a friend once told me. I think I remember...
sequence.name: Lulu

sequence.text: If you're ready, it's time. We go to Avernus! Hold on...!
sequence.name: Traxigor

sequence.text: Ain't gonna lie. Havin' ta work fer that Zodge blighter is chafin' me somethin' good.

The end will justify the means, Bruenor. Cultists on a murder spree in the city are worth our attention, even if the one calling the shots is only the lesser of two evils. The followers of the so-called Dead Three must be stopped. And if Zodge is true to his word, we'll be helping the Elturel refugees the best way we can.

Zodge said the cultists have set up their shrines to Bane, Bhaal, and Myrkul beneath a bathhouse owned by the Vanthampur family, close to the Upper City. But we'll have to hope the Flaming Fist are better at gathering intelligence than they are at keeping order.

The Vanthampurs? Thalamra Vanthampur is one of the dukes who govern Baldur's Gate. It sounds like this Captain Zodge is working two angles. We take out the cultists or they take us out. Either way, he loses one of the thorns in his side and the Vanthampurs are none the wiser of his connection to it all.

Heh. It'll take more than corrupt nobles and death cultists ta get this dwarf down. And Zodge needs ta learn that tryin' ta pluck a thorn out o' yer side with another thorn just tends ta leave ya stuck twice.
I do not remember Baldur's Gate so lively this way before. Maybe is just me?
Squeak!
sequence.name: Boo

sequence.text: More likely the number of times you've taken blows to the head is affecting your memory. So see if you can still remember how to charge that mob dead ahead.
Oh, yes! Charge is eternal! Boo! We go!
This city is a heartland of villainy. Will we need to fight our way along every street to even get to this bathhouse?
As long as we're in the Lower City, it's likely.
Oh, this all fine. Let Minsc and Boo lead along quiet back streets, and give excellent tour of Baldur's Gate! Come all!
Squeak!
sequence.name: Boo

sequence.text: So do we follow them? Or do we go our own way and let them draw all potential trouble down on themselves?
Best we stay close. He's tha best thing ta a guide we got, and we got a lot o' distance ta cover.
Confound these vermin! This is a brand-new cloak, and look! One edge gnawed right through.
No need for shouting. Pets are saying 'Welcome to Baldur's gate' is all.
It looks like the street welcoming committee has aerial support.
Ah, more friendly gulls! See them swoop down in excitement!
The line between excitement and murderous rage runs thin in Baldur's Gate. Everybody move!
Ah, look! Convenient alley shortcut.
Minsc, I don't mean to be difficult, but every time we enter an alley, we need to fight our way in, then fight our way out. Just sticking to one or the other would save us some time.
Ah, but you miss out on true Baldur's Gate experience that way. Listen to locals singing happy songs!
Pretty sure that's howling. Dogs howling. Lots and lots of dogs...
Ah, yes! Minsc and Boo know these streets well. All kinds of friendly folk to be found here.
Don't wanna be one ta judge tha company ye keep, Minsc. But that group up ahead don't look too friendly ta me.
Squeak?
sequence.name: Boo

sequence.text: Nonsense, Boo. You just need to get to know them.
Right. Minsc, I love ya like a brother, but we're gettin' hit hard here. We need ta cut a straighter course ta this bathhouse or we're still gonna be wanderin' tha city tomorrow.
All right, friend Bruenor. Minsc knows more best shortcuts. Simply... hey! Where is Minsc's dagger?
I see it slipping away courtesy of this thief. Hold up there!
Oh, sorry, friends. I was just in brief need of a blade, you see? There we go. Just trimming my nails. All yours now. I'll be on my way.
sequence.name: Masked Man

sequence.text: Wait! This villain is known to me! It is the masked man of Liar's Night!
Oi! I'm thinkin' ye're right. What's that blackguard doin' at large and in Baldur's Gate?
Given his long history of crime, I imagine he must be heading up the chamber of commerce. Just let him go... wait. Where's my purse?!?
Minsc sees shortcut straight to solid thrashing of masked villain. Follow me!
My friends! Is this violence really appropriate given all we've been through?
sequence.name: Masked Man

sequence.text: Well, if we're friends, perhaps you can cover me for a small loan? I happen to need the exact amount that's in that purse you're carrying.
My word! Those notebooks sticking out of his pack. Those are mine!
You two need to watch yourselves more carefully. You know the dangers of these streets, and... where's my holy symbol?
Right. Get inta position and hem these brigands in. Then someone start takin' inventory!
Right. I think that's everything accounted for. Now can we get out of here while we still have most of our clothing?
Ah! We are in luck. Next shortcut takes us to best site in Upper City. The view! You will astound selves with all the magnificence.
That sounds worthwhile. If we can get into the heights of the Upper City, we can see where we are. Then we might get a better sense of where we're going.
Is excellent plan. Follow Minsc!
Unbelievable. Even in the good part of town, Baldur's Gate is wall-to-wall with reeking vermin.
No, no! These Upper City vermin. Very clean, all things considered.
Squeak!
sequence.name: Boo

sequence.text: And the other stone shoe drops. Minsc! You dragged us up here to see your statue? As if we haven't wasted enough time?
Ah, friend Jarlaxle, you make jokes to shore up poor Minsc's sadness. For look! Magnificent Minsc's statue base has been broken! Pieces everywhere! My friends, we know what we must do!
Keep moving and hope to one day put the memory of this journey far behind us?
Yes! Collect statue pieces! Return Minsc to glory!
All right, Minsc, I think that's the last of the broken pieces. Can we please move on now?
Here's one more. Pretty sure this is yer butt.
Ah! Minsc was wondering where this was to be found.
Gotta say, looks a fair bit lopsided. Never really focused that close before.
Yes, well... sculptor was unable to fully capture Minsc's good side.
Squeak.
sequence.name: Boo

sequence.text: Well, against all odds and better judgment, I think we're on the right track at last. One of the wererats knows the bathhouse. We're not far.
Let's be on our guard, then. If the cultists of the Dead Three are active there, it's likely they'll be watching the place.
Right, we're here. And Nayeli's warning was apropos. I saw imps in flight above the street, scouting for intruders no doubt.
Oi! Got imps on tha ground closer in, too. And they're swarmin' someone!
No! Get away from me, you fiends! I know who you work for, and you won't take me today!
sequence.name: Mortlock

sequence.text: This one looks like he can handle himself in a fight. But I won't stand by while devils stalk a city, even one as foul as this. Come on!
Ye all right there, friend? Ye look like ye've been in some scrapes.
My face, you mean? A legacy from my childhood. And not the worst thing I've dealt with. I am Mortlock Vanthampur. You have my thanks.
sequence.name: Mortlock

sequence.text: Vanthampur? Your family's reputation precedes you. We're here to investigate the bathhouse. So perhaps you can repay our assistance by telling us what we'll find there.

Secret dungeons, filled with cultists of the Dead Three. What, you're surprised that I turn against my family? It was my brothers who ordered those imps to kill me. My loyalty to them is done. Stay close to me and I'll get you inside. Then I'll tell you what you need to know.
sequence.name: Mortlock

sequence.text: The Vanthampur family's villainy makes my blood run cold. Death cultists secretly controlling the corridors of power. Is there anyone in this city not dedicated to depravity?
There's us, and fer right now, that's gonna have ta be 'nuff.
You all talk when you should be fighting. That's a bad habit in Baldur's Gate -- as is dreaming that you can fix this city.
sequence.name: Mortlock

sequence.text: Long as we got mutual enemies, we can pretend we're on each other's side, friend. But make no mistake, we dinna come ta tha city ta stand by while folks is hurtin'. That ain't tha Champions' way. So ye just focus on gettin' us inside. Then we'll take care o' yer family business.
You don't know the half of it. The cultists of the Dead Three are legion, and they will fight to the death to hold this place.
sequence.name: Mortlock

sequence.text: Everybody stay sharp, then. And ye, Mortlock, keep outta our way. We're gonna clear these ruffians out before they know what hit 'em.
Them cultists is scramblin' back fast. Like they know somethin' else is comin' fer us.
Let it come. We'll soon have the evil of this place on the run.
No... that sound. D'ye hear it?!
I can hear... wait... is that clucking?
Aye! And 'tis tha cluck o' doom!
Heathen intruders! You think you can stand against the power of the gods and their most devoted servants?
sequence.name: Skull Lasher

sequence.text: The likes of you don't understand the first thing about holy power. Your evil ends here, villain! The justice of Tyr will be meted out today.
Brave words, paladin. Shall we see how your tone changes when you stare death in the face?
sequence.name: Skull Lasher

sequence.text: That's a good start ta this cult cleanup. But I got a feelin' there's lots more where those came from.

The worshipers of the Dead Three understand that there's strength in numbers. Myrkul, Bane, and Bhaal all reinforce each other's power. The three cults together are stronger by far than they would be standing alone.
That's not how I see it. Three gods of death cast their shadow in the mortal realm. But three shadows together don't make a deeper darkness. Our light will cleanse this place, one cultist at a time.
These tunnels are a veritable labyrinth. This looks like it was once sections of the Baldur's Gate sewers, but they've been sealed off.
Somebody's built themselves a private little dungeon complex down here. Nice and private. Perfect fer gettin' up ta no good.
And all but impossible to navigate. Everyone stay close -- and stay alert.
At least one of these cults has deep pockets. Those kobold mercenaries mean business.
Deep pockets indeed. All three of the cults and my family have tight connections to criminal business in the city.
sequence.name: Mortlock

sequence.text: By which you mean, 'business in the city.' And business is booming, by the look of it.
Oi! Pretty sure I can see tha end o' this kobold pack finally. We hit 'em with one more solid strike, we'll break these blighters.
Pretty sure that's exactly what they're thinking. But they're not going to go down easily!
These cultists is gettin' predictable. No tactics fer these rabble. They're used ta havin' tha strength o' numbers on their side.
That might be changing. I can sense new evil close by. Fiendish forces are on the move!
There! That figure shoutin' orders! That'll be tha leader o' this mob. We take him out, tha rest might think twice about sacrificin' themselves.
Stand fast! Stand for the power of tyranny and the Black Hand!
sequence.name: Iron Consul

sequence.text: I wouldn't put too much faith in their lack of faith, Bruenor. Bane keeps tight control over his minions. But I think I know a way to tip the balance in our favor.
Heretics! You sow your own destruction with your insolence. And when that destruction is complete, you will kneel before the Lord of Darkness and beg for your lives.
sequence.name: Iron Consul

sequence.text: I will kneel when this is done, villain, but only in prayer. Your lifeless body on the ground before me will be my offering. And when your soul passes to the darkness that awaits it, you may give your lord the message of Tyr's servant: No matter how long it takes, Baldur's Gate will see the light again.
There's fiendish evil ahead. More forces summoned from the darkness.
I can hear that infernal clucking. Oh, for a giant-sized barbecue pit...
Checkin' these last hallways, I think we're doin' a solid job o' clearin' this place out. Might be a bit o' doublin' back ta do, but we been hittin' 'em hard.
There's another force of fiends pushing out of that vault ahead. And a pack of cultists fleeing past them.
The main shrine of this infernal dungeon must be ahead. We've got the last of the Dead Three cultists cornered. Come on!
Everybody on me, and get ready fer one last push! These Bane cultists is losin' tha will ta fight!
Their god abandons them in their hour of need. A fitting end for those who worship a tyrant.
Don't judge the end of the fight too early. They've got reinforcements coming in!
You've done well, Champions. It's too bad my mother will be keen to repay you for your efforts.
sequence.name: Mortlock

sequence.text: Based on what we've seen down here, we'll be talking to your mother personally about the debt she owes us -- and to the people of Baldur's Gate.

Ha! I like your moxie, paladin. Even if it is going to get you killed. But if it's my mother you want, seek my brother, Amrik. You'll find him at the Low Lantern, down on the docks. He controls the finances of the Dead Three. And he was always her favorite.
sequence.name: Mortlock

sequence.text: Always good ta have tha next quest lined up before tha current one's done. No wastin' time. Go yer way, then, Mortlock. And fer yer own good, probably best if neither we nor yer mother see ya again.
The last of these cultists have nowhere to go! Hit them hard, Champions! Tear this profane altar down!
You have no power here, paladin! The Dead Three hold this place, and we, their servants, will bathe in your blood!
sequence.name: Reaper of Bhaal

sequence.text: I ain't normally one ta comment on anyone else's groomin' habits, friend, but that sounds downright unhygienic ta me.
This prattle tires me! I will have your tongue, dwarf! Then your head!
sequence.name: Reaper of Bhaal

sequence.text: All the empty words here come from you, lackey. The profane worshipers of three gods claiming power over all life, and in the end, all you have is boasting. I welcome the silence that will settle on this place when you fall -- and which might give some peace to the souls you've tormented in the name of darkness. Champions! Take them!
Feh. That fight ended with no surprises. Evil folk stand strong as long as they think they got tha upper hand. But faced with their own end, they break like a cheap blade.

There'll be work to do here cleaning up the aftermath of the cults' activities, and making sure these dungeons are sealed off. Hopefully we can find someone to trust in the city before our work here is done.
Wishful thinking, I suspect. But perhaps we'll... hey, what's Arkhan doing?
This is an outrage! This betrayal will not stand!
Oi! We been fightin' death cultists fer hours, and ye're only just gettin' outraged now?
This treasure amassed by the Dead Three has been stolen from Tiamat! We must protect it until it can be returned!
Best not to argue with him. He's doing that fanatical thing he does.
And not worth tha time in tha end. Sounds like we got a meetin' ta set up with another o' tha Vanthampur clan at tha Low Lantern. And we'd best be ready.

reset_currency_defines.name: Torm's Favor
reset_currency_defines.description: Favor with Torm, the god of duty and loyalty, revered by those who face danger to bring about a greater good.

properties.campaign_name: Grand Tour of the Sword Coast

reset_currency_defines.name: Chauntea's Favor
reset_currency_defines.description: Favor with Chauntea, the goddess of agriculture and the Great Mother, who is often worshipped by rural folk, especially during Highharvestide.

reset_currency_defines.name: Kelemvor's Favor
reset_currency_defines.description: Favor with Kelemvor, the lord of the dead, the judge of the damned, who despises the undead and seeks a peaceful transition for all.

reset_currency_defines.name: Leira's Favor
reset_currency_defines.description: Favor with Leira, the goddess of deception and illusions, who delights in the confusion sown by her various incarnations.

reset_currency_defines.name: Jergal's Favor
reset_currency_defines.description: Favor with Jergal, the final scribe, the pitiless one, the bleak seneschal, who abdicated control of the dead to three ambitious mortals.

reset_currency_defines.name: Shar's Favor
reset_currency_defines.description: Favor with Shar, the Mistress of the Night, the Dark Lady, Our Lady of Loss. The dark twin of Selune.

reset_currency_defines.name: Oghma's Favor
reset_currency_defines.description: Favor with Oghma, god of inspiration, invention, and knowledge. Their faithful spread knowledge and literacy far and wide.

reset_currency_defines.name: Eldath's Favor
reset_currency_defines.description: Favor with Eldath, a goddess of peace. Her presence is felt whereever there is calm.

reset_currency_defines.name: Sune's Favor
reset_currency_defines.description: Favor with Sune, the Lady of Love, the Princess of Passion. She is a deity of passion and delights of the senses.

reset_currency_defines.name: Umberlee's Favor
reset_currency_defines.description: Favor with Umberlee, the Bitch Queen, the Queen of the Depths, the Wavemother. Umberlee is feared by sailors and their loved ones alike.

reset_currency_defines.name: Lliira's Favor
reset_currency_defines.description: Favor with Lliira, Our Lady of Joy, Joybringer, Mistress of Revels. The beloved goddess of contentment, release, joy, happiness, dance, and freedom.

reset_currency_defines.name: Gond's Favor
reset_currency_defines.description: Favor with Gond, gold of artifce, craft, and construction.

reset_currency_defines.name: Helm's Favor
reset_currency_defines.description: Favor with Helm, god of watchfulness.

reset_currency_defines.name: Waukeen's Favor
reset_currency_defines.description: Favor with Waukeen, our lady of gold.

reset_currency_defines.name: Mystra's Favor
reset_currency_defines.description: Favor with Mystra, the goddess of magic and possibilities.

reset_currency_defines.name: Asmodeus's Favor
reset_currency_defines.description: Favor with Admodeus, Lord of the Ninth Hells.

reset_currency_defines.name: Savras' Favor
reset_currency_defines.description: Favor with Savras, god of divination and fortunetelling.

reset_currency_defines.name: Azuth's Favor
reset_currency_defines.description: Favor with Azuth, God of Wizardry.

reset_currency_defines.name: Tempus's Favor
reset_currency_defines.description: Favor with Tempus, the Lord of Battles.

reset_currency_defines.name: Tiamat's Favor
reset_currency_defines.description: Favor with Tiamat, the five-headed goddess of greed.

reset_currency_defines.name: Auril's Favor
reset_currency_defines.description: Favor with Auril, the Frostmaiden, the merciless goddess of cold and winter. Folk worship Auril to seek mercy from a hard winter.

challenges.description: Defeat 1000 humanoid enemies in Mirt variants or free plays
Defeat 1000 undead enemies in Mirt variants or free plays
Destroy 25 distractions during any Mirt variants or free plays
Collect 250 gems from boss loot bags during any Mirt variants or free plays
Complete 500 areas with Arkhan, Tyril, and Makos in your formation in any Mirt variants or free plays
Complete 500 areas WITHOUT any Support Champions in your formation in any Mirt variants or free plays
Reset any Mirt variant or free play in area 250+ with Delina as your highest total damage dealing, excluding ultimates (currently: $HIGHEST_BASE_ATTACK_CHAMPION$)
Earn 2500 Ruby Coins from Mirt free plays
Defeat 5000 beast enemies in Mirt variants or free plays
Use 250 ultimate attacks during any Mirt variants or free plays
Earn 500 Symbol of Vajra from Vajra free plays
Use 50 ultimate attacks during any Vajra variants or free plays
Destroy 25 distractions during any Vajra variants or free plays
Reset 2 Vajra free plays in area 200 or higher
Defeat 2500 humanoid enemies in Vajra variants or free plays
Defeat 2500 undead enemies in Vajra variants or free plays
Collect 250 gems from boss loot bags during any Vajra variants or free plays
Complete 1000 areas with Jamilah, Nayeli, and Bruenor in your formation in any Vajra variants or free plays
Complete 1000 areas WITHOUT any Support Champions in your formation in any Vajra variants or free plays
Defeat 1000 beast enemies in Strahd variants or free plays
Defeat 1000 undead enemies in Strahd variants or free plays
Complete 250 areas with K'Thriss, Dhadius, and Jim in your formation in any Strahd variants or free plays
Reset 2 Strahd free plays in area 200 or higher
Defeat 2500 humanoid enemies in Strahd variants or free plays
Reset any Strahd variant or free play in area 250+ with Artemis as your highest total damage dealing, excluding ultimates (currently: $HIGHEST_BASE_ATTACK_CHAMPION$)
Reset any Strahd variant or free play in area 250+ with a Tanking Champion as your highest total damage dealing, excluding ultimates (currently: $HIGHEST_BASE_ATTACK_CHAMPION$)
Use 250 ultimate attacks during any Strahd variants or free plays
Collect 500 gems from boss loot bags during any Strahd variants or free plays
Purchase 1 item from Strahd's Patron Shop

details.challenge_set_description: Idle Champions Presents: The Unfair Seas is a interactive livestream experience created by us, that you can influence. Get more influence by completing challenges

challenges.description: Beat area 100 in any free play adventure
Complete an adventure in area 100 or above with Minsc as your highest total damage dealer, excluding ultimates (currently: $HIGHEST_BASE_ATTACK_CHAMPION$)
Open at least 6 chests of any type
Complete an adventure in area 250 or above with Arkhan as your highest total damage dealer, excluding ultimates (currently: $HIGHEST_BASE_ATTACK_CHAMPION$)
Unlock (or have unlocked) Orisha from The Fleetswake event
Beat area 200 in any free play adventure
Complete an adventure in area 250 or above with Jamilah as your highest total damage dealer, excluding ultimates (currently: $HIGHEST_BASE_ATTACK_CHAMPION$)

Open an event or weekend promo chest (any chest that isn't a basic gold or silver chest)
Complete 500 areas with Orisha in your formation
Defeat the Kraken! Complete 1200 or more areas in a Fleetswake event adventure, variant, or free play
Open a Time Gate to unlock or gear up an event Champion
Complete an adventure in area 200 or above with Asharra as your highest total damage dealer, excluding ultimates (currently: $HIGHEST_BASE_ATTACK_CHAMPION$)
Purchase a Gold Chest with gems
Have 10 ultimate abilities on cooldown at the same time

Beat area 200 in any free play adventure
